result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael T. Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Offender - Fail/Update Information [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(4)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  DOC shall promptly notify the court of any new arrests or criminal charge made against the Deft.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  Special Pros K R Wells appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Terry Rose.  Sentencing arguments made. Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  Special Pros K R Wells appeared for the State.  Atty Terry Rose appeared on behalf of deft.  Deft not produced from prison.  Sentencing adj to 5/18/15 @ 11am.  New case set for FPT on 5/18/15 @ 11am as well.
